title: Time: How realistic is the BBC prison drama?
description: From blackmail to bullying, those with experience of the inside unpick the hard-hitting BBC drama.

title: Sonic the Hedgehog: 'I'd never seen anything like it in a video game'
description: Tam Kalinkse, one of the men responsible for gaming's most loveable hedgehog, speaks to Newsbeat.

title: Covid: Ivermectin to be studied as possible treatment in UK
description: Scientists begin to give the drug to people at home with symptoms to see if it can keep them out of hospital.

title: Wind turbines: How UK wants to become 'Saudi Arabia of wind'
description: With Britain's offshore wind power capacity growing at speed, we see how huge turbines are installed.

title: The trainer boss who even has a pair for funerals
description: Richard Johnson of Foot Locker has a pair of trainers for every occasion - even weddings and funerals.

title: What is different about the new £50 banknote?
description: A behind-the-scenes look inside a high-security banknote printing plant.

title: CEO Secrets: 'My billion-pound company has no office'
description: How Britain's youngest billionaire works differently - setting his firm up to thrive in lockdown.

title: Hungary's anti-gay law threatens programming of TV favourites
description: International condemnation grows towards a Hungarian law banning depiction of homosexuality to under-18s.

title: Elephants' 500km-trek across China baffles scientists
description: Scientists are surprised by how far they've gone and say they're displaying other unusual behaviours.

title: In pictures: Tartan Army's rollercoaster ride
description: Scotland fans endure joyous highs and familiar lows as the Euros campaign ends in defeat by Croatia.

title: Wally the Walrus takes a nap on Isles of Scilly fishing boat
description: The walrus took to a local fishing boat for a spot of sunbathing in the Isles of Scilly.

title: Wymondham mechanic finds python under bonnet during MOT
description: The snake named Gav, which belongs to the vehicle's owners, had been missing for two weeks.

title: GP data sharing: What is it and can I opt out?
description: A scheme to centralise GP patient records in England has been delayed after concerns about a lack of publicity.

title: New Zealand v India: 'He's perished!' - Gill takes great catch to dismiss Taylor
description: New Zealand's Ross Taylor is caught by India's Shubman Gill off Mohammed Shami on day five of the World Test Championship final at Hampshire Bowl.

title: NHS data strategy: Hancock defends data sharing plan
description: Critics fear data could be misused but the health secretary says the system will deliver better care.

title: DUP leadership: Sir Jeffrey Donaldson is only candidate
description: Sir Jeffrey is the only candidate and his name will now to go the party's electoral college.

title: Euro 2020: Uefa declines request to light up Allianz Arena in rainbow colours
description: Uefa declines a request to light up the Allianz Arena in rainbow colours before Germany's Euro 2020 match against Hungary on Wednesday.

title: What is white privilege?
description: A new education report by a group of MPs has caused debate because of references to white privilege.

title: Mason Mount and Ben Chilwell out of England's Euro 2020 clash with Czech Republic
description: England's Mason Mount and Ben Chilwell are out of Tuesday's game with the Czech Republic as they self-isolate because of a risk of Covid-19 exposure.

title: Poorer white pupils let down and neglected - MPs
description: White pupils from low income families are falling behind "every step of the way", an education committee says.

title: Emma Faulds murder: Ross Willox jailed for at least 20 years
description: Ross Willox killed Emma Faulds in his South Ayrshire home then dumped her naked body in the Galloway Forest.

title: Bumble closes to give 'burnt-out' staff a week's break
description: A senior employee wrote on Twitter that the extra holiday was to deal with "collective burnout".

title: British and Irish Lions: Eight debutants to face Japan
description: The British and Irish Lions will have eight debutants in their team to face Japan on Saturday.

title: US could slow Afghanistan withdrawal amid Taliban gains
description: The Pentagon says September is still its withdrawal target as the Taliban seizes land and weapons.

title: 'Why it’s time for Henderson to return for England'
description: Former England midfielder and BBC Sport columnist Danny Murphy says the Three Lions' final game in Group D against the Czech Republic is the perfect time to bring Jordan Henderson back into midfield.

title: Billie Eilish sorry for mouthing anti-Asian slur in resurfaced video
description: The singer said she's "appalled" by a clip which has been shared recently on TikTok.

title: Euro 2020: How do Scotland defeat Croatia?
description: Tactical analyst Stevie Grieve gives Scotland fans a guide to how their side might beat Croatia at Hampden.

title: Bobby Zamora scores spectacular goal for friend's team in Colchester
description: The ex-Premier League player was spotted playing for a friend's team in Colchester

title: Covid in Scotland: Sturgeon to confirm delay to lockdown easing
description: The first minister is expected to say a move to level zero in Scotland will be pushed back until mid-July.

title: Windrush Day: 'Windrush is the big thing in the black community'
description: Avril Nanton and Jody Burton have released a book looking at London's black history.

title: Covid vaccine: Why are Australians cancelling AstraZeneca jabs?
description: More people are shunning the world's most widely used Covid vaccine over its perceived risk.

title: The Papers: Covid chaos at Euros, and blow to foreign holidays
description: The news that Scotland footballer Billy Gilmour has tested positive for Covid features on many front pages.

title: Euro2020: 'Football at its absolute best' - Incredible goals & scenes from Denmark epic
description: Watch all the goals, celebrations and reaction from Denmark's emotional 4-1 victory over Russia on a frantic night in Copenhagen.

title: New York mayoral election: What voters want from a new mayor
description: Learn what's at stake as voters head to the polls to choose a new leader for New York City.
